title: The Reason why there are less Large sized protest in HK

replies.msg:
Dear friends from the world,
There are feeds from twitter or other social platforms asking why there are fewer large-sized protests in Hong Kong.

I think I have the obligation to explain the situation of us now.
Protests are being banned by police is a much common situation to account for this.

We the Hong Kongers have the freedom to hold our protests without interfered by the HKPF, no matter it is a protest of religion or protest for our freedom, they, the HKPF refuse to issue the Letter of No Objection, thus all protests becomes unlawful and mostly results in violence raid or sweeping by the HKPF.
With the use of not only pepper spray, but bullets to people who are fighting for their freedom.

However, even though the shameless HKPF keeps striking the protestors, we, the Hong Kongers are still fighting for our freedom.
Maybe you cannot see us in the street in Hong Kong Island, but we are still fighting in different districts.
Please continue to keep eyes on us and I suggest you to watch live streaming by various media on Facebook.

Best regards,
An ordinary student in Hong Kong
Sor9ry, I wrote this so sevenly, please don't judge me

The mtr cooperates with the Hong Kong police. Whenever protestors plan to have a large scale protest, mtr stops or suspend their service.
This makes some Hongkongers who live far away fail to participate (as most of these protests are held in Hong Kong Island). So now people protest in different districts instead.
